name: Hotel Becquer

reviews.text: We stayed here one night after we were double booked by the Vincci La Rabida hotel. This was very welcoming, pleasant and the bar nearby was very welcome for calming the fraught nerves in our party. Good location, nice rooms and helpful reception. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good hotel, nice location
Modern but Overpriced
reviews.text: Our 5-night stay was during the Feria and bullfight Abono. The property is modern but our room was the smallest of the 6 hotels we stayed at during our 3-week visit of Spain. The staff did answer questions but were not overly helpful when compared with other hotels.
In our estimation, the only good part about this hotel was the location.
reviews.title: Brilliant - Great place Great location
The best of the 3 hotels in Spain I've satyed
reviews.text: A definite negative was that the phone system does not allow use of Calling Cards and we had to use the pay phone on the street.
Brilliant
reviews.title: Could not fault it
We Loved This Hotel!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bequer for four nights in May and this may have been our favorite hotel in Spain. We had requested a quiet upgraded room directly from the hotel and feel that we got a good price and great value. The room was located in the newer section of the hotel and was large and nicely decorated. The bathroom was huge and had a separate shower and jacuzzi tub with fabulous spa amenities. The bed was bigger than a king and very comfortable. The breakfast at the hotel was substantial and a great way to start the day. The hotel is conveniently located and an easy walk to the Cathedral, Alcazar and Barrio Santa Cruz. It's just a block or two from the river and bridge over to Triana. We didn't have a lot of interaction with the staff but when we did, they were polite and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay at the Bequer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted an hotel for four nights in late April to allow us to tour and experience Sevilla - and picked The Becquer based on reports in the Forum. So glad we did. It is very goodt. Our third floor room over-looked the main Street - no problems with traffic noise. Very comfortable, spacious clean room - bathroom also excellent. They have (free) safes in the bedrooms now. Staff very helpful and polite. As we wanted to "experience" the city we ate out and not in the Hotel. Breakfasts were taken in the Indias bar opposite and the bar right next door to Hotel- excellent value and set us up for the day.
reviews.title: Very Good Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agree with comment re choice of teas in the rooms - we quickly bought a box of PG Tips and took it back to the room! Left car in Hotel garage (always pre- book this facility, it is small) and didn't touch it for the four days. Soon found quickest short route to get into "city centre" about 10-15minutes away at most. As Senior Citizens we felt quite safe walking back to the hotel late in the evening. Will look forward to going back some day.
reviews.title: Comfortable business and leisure hotel in Seville
comfortable, but a little old fashioned
reviews.text: The Becquer Hotel is a good 4 star hotel, possibly pitching for the business client more than the leisure client, but equally suitable for both. I was looking for a comfortable European 4 star hotel to retreat to after long days of sightseeing, and thats exactly what I got. It is more classic Spanish style than boutique modern so if you are expecting boutique then it won't be for you. Also if you are looking for cutesy Andalucian style with wrought iron balconies and cascading geraniums, then it won't be for you either - Santa Cruz is the place to look.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Becquer is ideally situated for all the major sights, all within walking distance (open air bus trip start point, boat trips, bull ring, museums plus 10 mins walk from the Cathedal and Alcazar). The hotel is on a fairly busy road but its not excessively noisy, you are in a city of 700,000 people after all ! The area is business and shopping orientated and yes, KFC, Burger King and Dominos Pizza are on the same road - I suppose better to have outlets like that there rather than in the historic centre which thankfully seemed to have avoided this type of imported eatery.
reviews.title: Did Not meet Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed staying in the Becquer. It's very conveniently located, the room was comfortable and lovely, and the price was right.
reviews.title: A Fine Choice in Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at Seville train station and took a taxi to Becquer, which cost 8 euros. This was an ok price. On arrival, we found the staff to be efficient, professional and friendly. We were offered a map of the city, which was helpful. Our booking in was dealt with in a straightforward manner, with no hassles.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, worth it, totally

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was immaculate. I cannot fault it. There was coffee making facilities, shower gels/ shampoos/ shoe shine etc all available. The beds were comfy and the shower was excellent. This hotel presents a feeling of a bygone era: as in when hotels cared about customers and their comfort. It is decorated in a traditional but modern style. It’s like a hotel you rarely se these days, in an age of plastic hoteliers. Maid service was daily. Shoeshine machines in the corridor and a reasonable mini bar. Room service ata reasonable price, averaging about 7 euros for a meal.
reviews.title: Quiet and comfortable hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was sublime. A taste for everyone…cold meats, cheeses and fruits allset out on a chilled glass plate. Hot food available: eggs, sausage and bacon and churros all presented wonderfully. Also a cereal/ yoghurt bar with various breads available. Staf attentive here, topping up coffee/ tea as required.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, quiet rooms, very convenient for the centre of Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooftop pool very impressive. Almost tempted to try it. Being from Scotland, we were tempted by the 21 degree temperature, but thought we might look quite ridiculous. In the summer this would be an oasis.
reviews.title: Good central position, clean

reviews.text: This was a charming hotel perfectly situated between the 3 most visited tourist neighborhoods in Seville (Santa Cruz, El Arenal and Triana), and an easy walk to all of them. The rooms are clean and spacious (by European standards), with nice amenities and plenty of storage. There is a wireless network in the lobby and the first 4 floors. The restaurant is great and very reasonable. We started here each morning with a breakfast Bocadilla (sandwich) and coffee for 3.50 Euros and returned in the afternoon for a beer and a delicious "1/2 racion" for under 10 Euros. There is a pristine rooftop pool, which was like an oasis on a hot day.
reviews.title: A real gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decided to go for this hotel rather than one with 'character' because we wanted to be sure of a quiet well appointed room with a reasonable amount of space. This is exactly what we got. Our double room (2 beds pushed together) looked out on to the inner patio and was perfectly peaceful. The beds were comfortable and the room had all the facilities we needed, including tea and coffee making equipment, which we have rarely found in continental hotels. The breakfast was of a high standard with plenty of choice and the staff were very helpful. We found the location excellent, within easy walking distance of all the main sites. It was also good to be just over the river from Triana, with its interesting and relatively inexpensive tapas bars. We enjoyed eating at the characterful Las Golondrinas - simple but felt authentic. The restaurants along the river in Triana are also worth having a look at. Eating by the river on a warm night and looking at the illuminated city was a real treat.
reviews.title: Very happy with our choice

reviews.text: Just returned from a week`s holiday and would recommend this hotel. Only problem was we booked a double room and were given a twin, however all the doubles face the busy street so stayed put as we did not want to risk the traffic noise. Stayed in room 611 and had no complaints, very quiet and clean,staff very helpfull, breakfasts good . Local buses very good. Visited Santiponce, Carmona, Jerez and Cordoba all by bus, very easy and worthwhile. You could do Granada in a full day but it was one too many for us
reviews.title: Very good choice for Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be warned, notwithstanding the current euro rate , Seville is very expensive but well worth a visit
reviews.title: Second leg of the honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Seville for the second portion of our honeymoon to Spain. Although we had booked Seville thinking that it would be in the heart of wine country, which it was not, we were able to relax more than we were able to in Barcelona. The hotel itself was in a good area, not very traveled, so that we felt like we were off the beaten path a little more than Barcelona. The staff was friendly, and the rooms were very clean.
reviews.title: Brilliant - almost
nice stay
reviews.text: Good location. Very clean and comfortable room. Front desk could be a little more friendly. Cafe next door has great tapas.
My wife, I and our 2 children stayed at Hotel Becquer for 4/5 nights this February whilst we were visiting friendswho live in Seville.
reviews.title: Need a doctor - watch out! They charged us €200

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our last night my son became ill (probably through some form of food poisoning - but NOT from the hotel itself) and after a very disturbed night we decided my wife and daughter had better travel back home as planned and leave my son and I at the hotel for an extra night.
reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY FACILITIES --LACKS CHARACTER

reviews.text: To ensure we met all our insurers requirements we had to obtain a certificate from a doctor to say my son was not fit to travel. I contacted reception to ask them to organise a doctor to visit and after being told it may be expensive, the concierge arranged this for us. At the time I considered €100 to be expensive!
reviews.title: Nice room, dumpy lobby, mediocre service

reviews.text: The doctor duly arrived very promptly, checked my sons temp, pulse, glands throat and eyes and left us with a prescription for some antibiotics, and anti-diarhoea medication and promptly charged us €200 for the 15mins he was there.
reviews.title: full service, old fashioned hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with a group of friends on a girls weekend. I was in a triple room, which was plenty big enough for 3 beds and had an enormous bathroom. The other 2 rooms we had were doubles and they also were a good size. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The best thing about this hotel is its position as it is only a few minutes walk to the river in one direction and the shops in the other. The best restaurants are on the other side of the river and the bridge is just at the end of the road. We had a last night meal in the Rio Grande which was lovely. Our rate was room only so we took the advice of other reviewers and had breakfast at the ajoining cafe/bar at the front of the hotel. This was very good value and quite sufficient. The weather was lovely so we didn't use the hotel bar either, but met each evening at the outside tables of the adjoining bar. The staff on the hotel desk were very helpful and booked the restaurant and flamenco show for us.
reviews.title: Good position and good value

reviews.text: All in all we had a very good few days. The shops were excellent, especially for shoes! and the hotel was just what we wanted. We went to Cordoba by high speed train for a day which was well worth the visit. My only other advice to travellers to Seville would be to ensure that you take a phrase book. Many of the shopkeepers/waiters/train station staff do not speak any English.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights end of May and beginning of June. We were quite satisfied. The hotel has two sections. Our room was at the very end of the hallway in the newer addition. The room was average or better sized by American standards and quite large by European standards. The bathroom was also generous. Both were nicely appointed. We found the staff quite helpful and very friendly. They helped us with cancellation of another hotel reservation and arranged a day trip to Granada for us. We did not eat at the hotel. There are nice restaurants, cafes, ice cream, a Burger King and a Pizza Hut all within about two blocks of the hotel. As other reviews have noted, it is only a 10 minute walk to the cathedral and the Alcazar. There is a taxi stand immediately outside the hotel's front door. A word of caution: some rooms in both the older section and the newer section face into an interior atrium. I would not be especially happy with these rooms and would much prefer rooms facing a street. A side note: we needed to wash clothes in Seville and did not wish to pay hotel prices, which I calculate would have been 50-100 euros for what we had. Instead, we found two lavanderias on side streets between the hotel and the cathedral where we could have our clothes washed, dried, and folded in a matter of a few hours for 5-6 euros per load (we had two loads). The first, which we checked out but did not use because the hours were not as convenient for us is Lavanderia Robledo; it is at the turn in Calle Federico Sanchez Bedoya (#18), not much more than an alley that runs off Avenida de la Constitucion opposite the cathedral. The proprietor did not speak any English and we do not speak any Spanish, but we managed to communicate that they had finished washing for the day but they would be glad to do it the next and it would take about 4 hours. Instead, we used Lavanderia y Tinto Roma, Calle Casteler, #2, which is actually just a block or so away from Lavanderia Robledo, closer to the bullring. This is an English friendly establishment; we dropped off the wash before 10:00 and it was ready at 12:30. Both are an easy walk from the hotel, even carrying your dirty laundry. Bottom line: No complaints. If I return to Seville, Hotel Becquer will be my first choice.
reviews.title: Great Location, bit pricey
Wonderful Hotel! Great location!
reviews.text: The location of the hotel makes it an ideal spot to tour the city. Walking distance to the various sections/areas the city is broken up into. Close to the main river section so evening meals and sangria sessions till 2am still means a short pleasant stroll back. The Hotel is very clean and modern. Room was small even for the price but again, spotless. Quiet which was good for the sleep deprived. Staff was very helpful with checking in and giving us tour tips. We didn't go for the buffett breakfast as there are so many cafes close by.

reviews.title: Did not like this hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Becquer hotel at the end of May. The hotel was spotless. It was modern and very welcoming. The staff was very helpful and we checked in a few hours early with no problems. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is within walking distance to quite a few places.
Nice rooms, quiet, clean, efficient, and good location. I would stay again.
reviews.title: Neutral / average
Refused (!?!) to call us a taxi
reviews.text: Hotel Becquer is in an excellent location, and our rooms were good-sized and kept very clean.

The only thing that marred our stay were surly front desk staff, who were unfriendly at check-in, and on check-out actually refused to call us a taxi. Yes, there is a taxi-stand in front of the hotel, but we waited there for 20 minutes before asking them - again - to make the call. We had to drag our gear down to the main road along the river, where we eventually managed to flag down a cab. Bizarre behaviour.
reviews.title: Great Stay!
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights and had a great time. We were originally put into a nice room on the 5th floor but they are building a pool on the top level so there was a lot of banging. We asked to move and they put us in the newer part of the hotel - which was an AMAZING room! I would highly recommend requesting one of these rooms. The hotel location is ideal. Close to the water, the old city and all other locations you'll want to visit in Seville. We stayed in 4 different hotels while visiting Spain and this was our favorite by far!

Just returned from a one-night stay in Seville where we were very pleased with the hotel Becquer. The location was very easy to find as we drove into town and was also a short walk to the old-town center. The staff was friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our short stay in their beautiful city. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I've experienced in all of Spain. Our room in the new section of the hotel was very quiet and extremely spacious by European standards. Even the fussiest traveler would be hard pressed to find fault with the hotel Becquer. Super experience at a super price.
reviews.title: Ideal for Seville
Enjoyed staying at the Becquer
reviews.text: We stayed at the Becquer for 5 nights in mid-March 2006 and thoroughly enjoyed it. Both the room and the bathroom were large and clean and the maid service did a good job on a daily basis. We rented a car while in Seville and parked it in the hotel's basement garage, which was a great convenience as it is not easy to park elsewhere in the city. All of the major tourist sites in the city are within walking distance of the hotel. The only complaint we had was the breakfast, which we found to be overpriced. After eating breakfast the first day in the restaurant, we opted the rest of the time to have breakfast in the adjoining bar at the front of the hotel where we could get toast, butter and jam, and cafe con leche at about a fifth of the price of the hotel's buffet breakfast.
Stayed at this hotel 2 nights March 2006.
reviews.title: Good Choice for Seville

reviews.text: Agree with other comments re staff courtesy and location - just 10 minutes to Cathedral and Real Alcazar (which is not to be missed). Also close to shopping area.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Some decent restaurants close by, and particularly recommend Tapas at the 'El Cairo', just across road from main hotel entrance. Spent a thoroughly enjoyable evening sampling the tapas in the bar of El Cairo, where the staff were very courteous & obliging. We were the only non-Spanish people at the bar, so seemingly popular with the locals.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Excxellent hotel in ideal location
reviews.text: Hotel room well insulated from outside traffic sounds and clean/comfortable with decent breakfast. Some renovation in progress in public areas of hotel, but should be completed fairly soon, so should not really detract.

description: The Becquer Hotel, is located in the historical and commercial centre of the city, next to the Guadalquivir River, just 5 minutes walk from the Cathedral, Giralda, Barrio de Santa Cruz and a step away form the area of Tapas (Triana). With very easy access to buses and a private garage for hotel guests.There are 134 rooms fully equipped with private bathroom, plasma TV, WIFI, minibar, safe, air conditioning or heating, trouser press, laundry service, free coffee/tea maker in the room, room service until 24:00, etc ...The hotel also has meeting rooms, fully equipped with free WIFI, loudspeakers and audiovisuals.We also offers an extraordinary SPA in which we use all-natural techniques and innovative methods to relax.Outdoor swimming pool, Terrace and Solarium with wonderful views of the Cathedral and the Giralda.
